Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the LORD, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite. O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:<RF>words: or, business<Rf>
Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending <FI>it<Fi> in pieces, while <FI>there is<Fi> none to deliver.<RF>none…: Heb. not a deliverer<Rf>
O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take <FI>it<Fi>; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me <FI>to<Fi> the judgment <FI>that<Fi> thou hast commanded.
So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity <FI>that is<Fi> in me.
Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.<CM>
My defence <FI>is<Fi> of God, which saveth the upright in heart.<RF>My…: Heb. My buckler is upon God<Rf>
God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry <FI>with the wicked<Fi> every day.<RF>judgeth…: or, is a righteous judge<Rf>
If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch <FI>which<Fi> he made.<RF>He made a pit: Heb. He hath digged a pit<Rf>
His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.<CM>
